page.title: 01Isle of Auskerry
page.content: A small grass and heather covered island, the highest point being 60 ft cliffs. A quarter of the island is coastline is cliff (4 caves) the rest is rocky shores and gravel beaches. The unmanned lighthouse rises 110 ft ASL. Simon Brogan and Teresa Probert live in a one-roomed stone botht with wind generated 12 volt electricity and no washing or sanitation facilities. (stove is entirely fuelled from the islands peat and driftwood). We make a living from farming our 200 shetland & cheviot flock that graze the entire island and eat seaweed. We have fenced 8 enclosures centred on the lighthouse walled garden for flock management and pasture improvement. In the winter months we supplement our income with home cured northronaldsay and other sheepskins sold as rugs and other clothing items.
